page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: KIRKLISTON,NEWBRIDGE, RATHO STATION The area is dominated by Edinburgh Airport whose main runway almost halves the block in a south-west to north-east direction.This runway was extended in the mid 1970's and the old Newbridge School which served the villages of Newbridge and Ratho Station was replaced by Hillwood School,officially opened in June 1976.The other main village in the block is Kirkliston. The Royal Highland Showground is the permanent home of the most important agricultural show in Scotland. Modern industrial sites have been developed to provide local employment. Factories include a combine manufacturer's, a home security firm, a multiple fruit supplier which serves many of Edinburgh's supermarkets, a whisky bond and a chicken factory.
